Abstract Abstract
This draft is to define a way to configure MPL parameter via DHCPv6 This draft is to define a way to configure MPL parameter via DHCPv6
option. option.

1. Introduction 1. Introduction
Multicast Protocol for Low power and Lossy Networks (MPL) Multicast Protocol for Low power and Lossy Networks (MPL)
[I-D.ietf-roll-trickle-mcast] defines a protocol to make a multicast [I-D.ietf-roll-trickle-mcast] defines a protocol to make a multicast
network among low power and lossy network i.e. wireless mesh network among low power and lossy network i.e. wireless mesh
networks. MPL has various parameters to control its behavior and networks. MPL has various parameters to control its behavior and
tradeoff between end-to-end delay and network utilization. In some tradeoff between end-to-end delay and network utilization. In some
environments, the parameters shall be configured carefully to meet environments, the parameters shall be configured carefully to meet
each environment and requirement. According to the MPL draft section each environment and requirement. According to the MPL draft section

3. Operation of MPL Forwarders 2.3. DHCPv6 Client Behavior
As a node receives MPL parameter configuration option, the node Clients MAY request MPL Parameter Configuration Option, as described
SHOULD join the MPL domain given by the option and act as an MPL in RFC3315 [RFC3315], sections 17.1.1, 18.1.1, 18.1.3, 18.1.4, 18.1.5
forwarder. Nodes SHOULD configure MPL forwarders when it joins to and 22.7. As a convenience to the reader, we mention here that the
the MPL domain with the given parameters. client includes requested option codes in Option Request Option.
Clients MUST discard MPL Parameter Configuration Option if it is
invalid (i.e. it sets reserved bits or it has timers with reserved
exp=7 in Unsigned Short Floating Point).
2.4. MPL Forwarder Behavior
If a DHCPv6 client requests and receives MPL parameter configuration
option, the node SHOULD join the MPL domain given by the option and
act as an MPL forwarder. Nodes SHOULD configure MPL forwarders with
the given parameters when it joins to the MPL domain.
The priority of MPL Parameter configuration applied for an MPL Domain The priority of MPL Parameter configuration applied for an MPL Domain
is as follows (high to low). is as follows (high to low).
o Specific MPL Parameter Configuration to the MPL Domain (optlen=32) o Specific MPL Parameter Configuration to the MPL Domain (optlen=32)
o Wildcard MPL Parameter Configuration (optlen=16) o Wildcard MPL Parameter Configuration (optlen=16)
o Default configuration given in the MPL specification. o Default configuration given in the MPL specification.
There SHALL be no more than one MPL parameter configuration option There SHALL be no more than one MPL parameter configuration option
for a MPL domain or the wildcard. Thus, the order of DHCPv6 option for a MPL domain or the wildcard. Thus, the order of DHCPv6 option
in the packet has no effect on precedence. in the packet has no effect on precedence.
The MPL parameters given in this option is only applicable for new
MPL domains. Existing active MPL forwarder instances SHOULD NOT be
updated.
A node MAY leave from an MPL domain if the node is attached to the A node MAY leave from an MPL domain if the node is attached to the
MPL domain according to previously received MPL parameter MPL domain according to previously received MPL parameter
configuration option, and, the node received updated MPL parameter configuration option, and, the node received updated MPL parameter
configuration option without specific configuration option for the configuration option without specific configuration option for the
MPL domain. MPL domain.
4. IANA Considerations MPL parameter may be updated occasionally. With stateful DHCPv6,
updates can be done when the renewal timer expires. However, on
stateless DHCPv6 there are no way to update the parameters properly.
There is a DHCPv6 option to push updates
[I-D.jiang-dhc-stateless-reconfiguration].
2.5. DHCPv6 Server Behavior
Sections 17.2.2 and 18.2 of RFC3315 [RFC3315] govern server operation
in regards to option assignment. As a convenience to the reader, we
mention here that the server will send MPL Parameter Configuration
Option only if configured with specific value for MPL Parameter
Configuration Option and the client requested it.
Servers MUST ignore incoming MPL Parameter Configuration Option.
2.6. DHCPv6 Relay Behavior
It's never appropriate for a relay agent to add options to a message
heading toward the client, and relay agents don't actually construct
Relay-Reply messages anyway. There are no additional requirements
for relays.
3. IANA Considerations
A DHCPv6 option code for MPL Parameter Configuration Option needs to A DHCPv6 option code for MPL Parameter Configuration Option needs to
be assigned from IANA. be assigned from IANA.
5. Security Considerations 4. Security Considerations
Forged option may cause too many MAC broadcasting. Reasonable bound Forged option may cause too many MAC broadcasting. Reasonable bound
of parameters (not too high K, not too low IMIN) may be defined by of parameters (not too high K, not too low IMIN) may be defined by
implementations or derived from MAC/PHY specifications. DHCP server implementations or derived from MAC/PHY specifications. DHCP server
or the network itself shall be trusted by some means including or the network itself shall be trusted by some means including
network access control or DHCP authentications. network access control or DHCP authentications.
